## Bio

I am Assistant Professor at [University of Campinas](https://www.unicamp.br/unicamp/) ([Department of Statistics](https://www.ime.unicamp.br/)) - Brazil. My research interests are risk management, portfolio allocation, volatility forecasting, robust statistics, and statistical learning.

I received the [y-BIS Best Paper Award](https://www.ime.unicamp.br/destaques/carlos-trucios-maza-recebe-premio-asaniss-best-bis-paper-awards-2016) (2016), [IASC-ERS Young Researchers Award](https://iasc-isi.org/2019/06/27/iasc-ers-young-researchers-award-2018-at-compstat-2018/) (2018), and the [Best paper Award in the Latin American Conference for Statistical Computing](https://iasc-isi.org/2019/06/27/best-lacsc-2019-paper-award/) (2019).

Before I joined University of Campinas, I worked in Brazilian companies as a Data Science Specialist, Data Science Coordinator, and Data Scientist Consultant. I also was Visiting Professor at Federal University of ABC and Assistant Professor at Federal University of Rio de Janeiro.


Currently, my goal is to apply statistical learning techniques on Business, Economics and Finance as well as develop new volatility forecasting procedures in high-dimensional and high-frequency data.
